tag_list: pr, social-media, startup-advisor, consultant, seed-investor, angel-investor, seed-fund, angel-fund
overview:
Co-founder and CEO of Tech PR and social media firm Atomic, a Grayling agency. Co-founder and managing board member of related firm, H30 Communications. PR and social analytics pioneer. Partner and angel investor at Theorem Ventures.

Atomic, H30 and Theorem-developed analytics technology and IP were acquired by Huntsworth plc on March 23, 2011 for $13.3 million upfront in a 5 year contract capped at more than $40M.

Founded in 2007, Theorem Ventures invests in early and mid-stage Internet, social, mobile and deep tech companies. Theorem portfolio companies include Smule, Visual.ly, Moonfruit (acquired 2012 by Yell), Kidzui (acquired 2012 by Saban), Delphix, Pixt, Sokanu, MileSense, Pagelever, Traackr, FundersClub and others.

Andy and associates have managed the PR and social media for more than 100 start up launches in the past 6 years. More than 40 Atomic clients have been acquired or IPO’d during the same time including Evolve, Outerbay, Webify, Vurv, StepUp Commerce, Photobucket, Rapt, Xign, Bebo, AdWhirl, Mint.com, TutorVista, Simplify Media, Milo, Velti, Fusion.io, Arcsight, Moonfruit and more than 20 others.

Atomic and related agency H30 have also managed high profile PR and social programs for a range of global tech, Web 2.0 and consumer brands including Verizon, Sony, Polaroid, Pioneer, LinkedIn, Intuit, McAfee, IMAX, Hitachi and many others.

milestones.description: Atomic PR, H3O Communications and ComContext analytics platform acquired by Huntsworth plc.  Andy Getsey named CEO of Atomic North America, a Grayling Company
Theorem portfolio company Moonfruit acquired by Yell for $30,000,000.
